reviewText: I'm a big fan of the Paranormnal Activity movies and this is cut out of the same piece of cloth. This deserves a wider audience.
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn

reviewText: This is a stylish, British, "They check in, but they don't check out" horror film.  It's obvious someone took a look at Paranormal Activity, and the same sort of scares happen here.  There's also a good amount of casual sex and nudity involving attractive women, which is always appreciated.  Naturally, this kind of fun is soon severely punished.  There's a legend of course, and tons of blood, and somebody or something picking people off one by one--but just the mates of the three couples at first.  The innkeeper, of the Tony Perkins variety, is a likely suspect.  Unfortunately, nobody's very likeable or interesting, so we don't particularly care what happens to the characters, but all in all an enjoyable low-budget effort if you like this sort of thing.  Let the "extras" roll after the credits--they're entertaining as well.
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn

reviewText: Hope you are ready for a good, scary movie because this one delivers. I've seen similar plots before of course but this still had me guessing and made me jump out of my chair more than once. Horror fans will dig this.
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn

reviewText: Looking for the next great movie about ghosts and other supernatural phenomenon? "Paranormal Haunting: Curse of the Blue Moon Inn" is certainly a title and a DVD package meant to evoke a certain type of film. Unfortunately, the expectations being set prior to watching the movie have little to do with the actual movie. Paranormal? Haunting? If your idea of chilling paranormal activity is to see a chair knocked over or a lamp switch on and off, then this is the right place. Instead, this movie is a bit of a catch all--not sure which plot point is driving the main narrative. Is the place haunted? Is an unusual lunar event the cause of unspeakable evil? Or is the danger something decidedly more human? Depending on where you are in the movie, it's all three--and this casual and inconsistent approach to the story telling does little to make for a satisfying viewing experience.This is the latest offering from extreme indie auteur Philip Gardiner. Gardiner may have a specialized following, I'm not sure--but he tends to deal in low budget erotica. His effort "Cam-Girl," to my mind, is his most successful piece to date as it utilized minimal sets and essentially one actress. The film needed to be creative to work and, though not perfect, was an interesting example of rogue film making techniques. Everything got bigger and more convoluted with his "House of Sin"--a film loaded with arty and awkward pretensions amidst the nudity. These films shared a high quotient of female flesh, so it's fair to say that's his wheelhouse format. He seems to be moving toward more supernatural based thrillers (this and The Stone), and I'm not sure whether these endeavors will satisfy his conventional fan base. They have incidental nudity, completely irrelevant to the plot, but can't really be classified in the same erotica category as his previous works.In this film, a varied group of strangers arrive at the Blue Moon Inn to witness a unique lunar occurrence that only happens once every hundred years. There is talk of the evil this event causes, but the inn already seems to be haunted. Add to this a weird guy walking around town who plants a pretty wicked looking talisman under each of the visitors' mattresses. There are plenty of long stagnant shots where nothing happens (a Gardiner trademark), but the film takes an unexpected turn for the finale. It's not paranormal, per se. And it's not a haunting, per se. But at least it is interesting. I wish the rest of the movie were about what was actually leading up to this conclusion instead of being a jumble of themes. The final sequences are perhaps the most effective scenes in any of Gardiner's movies, they just didn't cohere with the rest of the narrative. An extra star for the end, this is still only for people who know what to expect from a Gardiner picture. KGHarris, 8/11.
summary: A Jumble Of Themes In This Extreme Indie Presentation Which Is NOT Really About Paranormal Haunting
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn

reviewText: This was one of those stories that I found myself thinking about late at night after watching...it kind of sneaks up on you how creepy this actually is.  The ending is really creepy!  I love a good ghost story.
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn

reviewText: I watched this with a few friends and scared all of us pretty good.  This reminded me of some of the classic suspense movies in that it's not necessarily about blood and gore but more about playing with your imagination.
Title: Paranormal Haunting: Curse Of The Blue Moon Inn
